verbs.description: upend (third-person singular simple present upends, present participle upending, simple past and past participle upended)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To end up; to set on end.

examples: When he upended the bottle of water over his sleeping sister, the lid popped off and surprised them both.
upend the box and empty the contents

entries.meaning: (figurative) To destroy, invalidate, overthrow, or defeat.
examples: The scientific evidence upended the popular myth.
By the middle of March 2020, the COVID-19 pandemic upended normal life for virtually all Americans.
